resources.string:
Shuttle Tracker shows you the real-time locations of the RPI campus shuttles, powered by crowd-sourced location data.


Schedule 
Monday through Friday: 7:00 AM to 11:45 PM 
Saturday: 9:00 AM to 11:45 PM 
Sunday: 9:00 AM to 8:00 PM


Instructions 
The map is automatically refreshed every 5 seconds. Green buses have high-quality location data, and red buses have low-quality location data. In colorblind mode, the green buses are replaced by buses with an aqua target/scope icon, and the red buses are replaced by a purple dial icon. When boarding a bus, tap "Board Bus", and when getting off, tap "Leave Bus". You must be within 20 meters of a stop to board a bus.


Privacy 
Shuttle Tracker sends your location data to our server only when you tap "Board Bus" and stops sending these data when you tap "Leave Bus". Your location data are associated with an anonymous, random identifier that rotates every time you start a new shuttle trip. These data aren't associated with your name, Google account, RCS ID, or any other identifying information. We continuously purge location data that are more than 30 seconds old from our server. We may retain resolved location data that are calculated using a combination of system and user-reported data indefinitely, but these resolved data don't correspond with any specific user-reported coordinates.

Shuttle tracker is developed by the Rensselaer Center for Open Source by your fellow RPI students. As an open source application, anyone can help develop the RPI Shuttle Tracker regardless of experience! Any contributions are welcome, as well as feedback for our current team. If you would like to view our source code, click the button below and open our GitHub page, and you can open an \"issue\" to leave feedback for us.
